intro: Schmidelia chartacea, commonly known as the paperleaf schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves that are thin and papery in texture. Its small, pale purple flowers bloom in late spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to its appearance. Schmidelia chartacea is often found in moist, shaded woodlands and is adapted to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
